meanings.definition: To add up the total of something.
meanings.sent1: I totaled the number of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She totaled the scores of the game to find the winner.
meanings.sent3: The teacher totaled the points for each student in the class.
meanings.sent4: He totaled the expenses for the month to create a budget.
meanings.sent5: The cashier totaled the cost of the groceries at the checkout.

meanings.definition: To completely destroy or wreck something.
meanings.sent1: The storm totaled the old barn on the farm.
meanings.sent2: The car accident totaled the vehicle beyond repair.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to total all the dishes on the tray.
meanings.sent4: The fire quickly totaled the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The floodwaters totaled the crops in the field.
